Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Much slower than centralized exchanges

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: What I really wanted to find out tonight is whether there really is a decentralised exchange that exists yet which simply cannot be sabotaged either by Uncle Sam or indeed the developers themselves

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: It doesn't have to be one that checks _every_ box like being able to trade dust etc

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Nothing is invulnerable . But in terms of decentralization BarterDEX is king.    It allows you to form your own P2P network,  none of the others are doing that

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: I just mean to Bitcoin's standard

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: Obviously that's vulnerable to consensus lols

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: But as long as those who form that don't all signal for a really retarded change

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: The reason I'm delving into this is because last year I had a theory that the crypto world may end up split into two

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: And sure enough some months later Japan suddenly takes a dim view to the coins you'd expect heh

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: So it makes sense that sooner rather than later any exchanges trading "krypto" will have to comply in one way or another

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: Or else of course simply be as untouchable as Bitcoin is decentralisation-wise so that all they can do is shake their fists at it

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: It seems obvious to me that it's only a matter of time before hegemonists will try to properly block those

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: Once it becomes a popular means for the little guy to not pay his fair share just like the rich mostly do these days heh

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: But of course whether anyone will tip their tin foil hats to that here is neither here nor there heh

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Bitcoin is one network.  In BarterDEX you can have many networks. I would say it's more decentralized.

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: So would BarterDEX be somewhere that folks could use to flog 100 XMR anonymously and walk off with the BTC?

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Except cryptonight and it's variants are not currently compatible

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: And if our backward Game of Drones oligarch-driven world decides that XMR is a terrorist coin is there anything they could actually do about it?

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: Ah okay heh well I mean supposing for now it _is_ (any idea what the ETA is?)

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Whenever monerolabs figures out how to emulate bitcoin style multisig in their ring signature scheme

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: If we suppose for the sake of argument that were to happen this year

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: I'm only using XMR as an example really because I think that's going to become public enemy #1

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: If it became compatible someone would probably add it

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: Ignoring that for now though

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: Say it appears and it becomes heavily used on BarterDEX

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: And then boom another 9/11 and oh look these funny-looking people were paid in XMR and we know because they were all wearing Monero cable-knits and they all survived the explosion somehow

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: Can the feds stop XMR from being traded on BarterDEX?

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: No

Author: Shingo Murata#3184
Content: Excellent

Author: [TPUX] Djith Wattignies#3171
Content:
Guys.. i just got blown away.
I got adviced not to mine to an adress i created with my nano ledger. So im mining straight to that adress.
Now it is stated that i am destroying my ledger doing so because of all the tiny transactions im doing to it. Too many write cycles..

What a bullshit.. the ledger only serves to consult balance..

Wow.. just wow.. too many idiots around trying to convince you of utterly crap random bullshit

Author: ca333#0118
Content:
@[TPUX] Djith Wattignies you shouldnt be able to destroy your ledger by doing so. the only reason i could think of that ledgerHQ doesnt like this (or why this random BS is being spread) is because of the additional load for their infrastructure. BOLOS - their blockchain operating system which acts like a SPV network that does broadcast all the BC data could be overloaded if all users mine into their ledger device. This could potentially have a similar effect like a DDOS attack. 

But again - dont worry ref. your ledger - it does nothing else than holding your keys and signing the transactions. The rest happens on the client-software. So worst case if client-software wont be able to handle the Tx load just reset device - use new seed - import old seed to Agama - transfer funds to new ledger key(s).

Author: [TPUX] Djith Wattignies#3171
Content: Thats how it is .. but it states on ledger support that micropayements to ledger will wreck up the device üòÇ

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is like SPV, which might actually have a limit of utxo (around 1000)

Author: [TPUX] Djith Wattignies#3171
Content: Okay.. but to mine at such extend you create a 1000 payements to your wallet.. :)

Author: JAPK#3085
Content:
Hello.
I have one question.....

Is it possible to confirm in blockchain the contract 10 sec after the contract is executed 10 seconds before the block is created? Or do I have to wait 1 minute 10 seconds?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can look in the mempool for near instant results, but until its confirmed it is unconfirmed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and even after confirmed, until notarized, subject to longest chain rule

Author: JAPK#3085
Content: Does it mean that at least 10 confirmed blocks are safe?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: once it gets notarized, it is much more secure. notarization lag varies, but you can check it on: https://komodostats.com/api/notary/summary.json

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: most are indeed less than "lag" of 10

Author: JAPK#3085
Content:
It will be 10 minutes before the smart contract will be valid.
Is it right?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the contract is valid

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you send funds to it and the contract does what the contract does
